intro: Clidemia oocarpa, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. Clidemia oocarpa is often found in moist, shaded areas and can thrive in disturbed habitats.
